snippet: The federal education law has still not been reauthorized, as controversy continues over its last version, No Child Left Behind, and its requirements on student progress and teacher evaluations.
abstract: News analysis; Elementary and Secondary Act, law governing all public schools that receive federal financing, has still not been reauthorized, despite repeated efforts over last five years; controversy continues over its last version, No Child Left Behind Act; lawmakers debate over how federal government should holds states and schools accountable for students' academic progress and teacher evaluations.
lead_paragraph: The federal education law has still not been reauthorized, as controversy continues over its last version, No Child Left Behind, and its requirements on student progress and teacher evaluations.

headline.seo: Debate Over Federal Role in Public School Policy
